text: Customers often have to maintain a data backup and compliance

posture that meets their backup
governance requirements and regulations
Certain customers may need to track their backup activity

evaluate if the activity meets their defined
backup governance policies
such as specific backup schedules or retention periods

and generate audit-ready reports to demonstrate backup
compliance to auditors or regulators

Now, with AWS Backup Audit Manager, you can simplify data
governance and compliance management of your backups
By using built-in customizable controls and defining parameters
such as backup frequency or retention period

you can audit your backups to see if they satisfy your
organizational and regulatory requirements
Audit Manager automatically tracks your backup activities

and detects when your backup activity drifts from your
defined parameters

enabling you to take quick corrective actions that can
help strengthen your compliance posture

With AWS Backup Audit Manager, you can generate
periodic or on-demand reports to demonstrate
compliance with your control parameters to auditors and regulators

You can also use reports to identify any necessary corrective
actions on your end

For example, you can create backup activity reports to track the
status of your backup, copy, and restore jobs

You can start using AWS Backup Audit Manager with just a
few clicks in the AWS Backup management console

Set up your customizable Audit Manager controls to
create a framework or a group of controls

You can then use the dashboards generated by Audit Manager
to gain a centralized view of
your backup activity and compliance status
To learn more about AWS Backup Audit Manager

visit the AWS Backup product page
at aws.amazon.com/backup
